'''Túrin I''' ([[Third Age]] {{TA|2165|n}}<ref name="Elendil"/> – {{TA|2278|n}},<ref name="South">{{App|South}}</ref> aged 113 years) was the sixth [[Ruling Steward]] of [[Gondor]].

==History==
Túrin's stewardship occurred during the period of the [[Watchful Peace]] ({{TA|2063}}-{{TA|2460|n}}).<ref>{{App|TA}}</ref>

Túrin ruled as Steward for thirty-four years. Very unusually for a noble of Gondor, he married twice and had several daughters. Only his last child, born in his old age, was a son,<ref name="Elendil"/> [[Hador (Steward of Gondor)|Hador]] by whom he was succeeded.<ref name="South"/>

==Etymology==
For the meaning of his name refer to [[Túrin#Etymology|Túrin - Etymology]]. Túrin I was probably named after [[Túrin|Túrin Turambar]], a tragic hero of the [[Edain]] of the [[First Age]].<ref>{{NM|P2v}}, footnote 3, p. 189</ref><ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, p. 203</ref>
